meanings.definition: To bury (a dead body) in the ground.
meanings.sent1: They decided to inhume their beloved pet in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The family gathered to inhume their grandfather in the family plot.
meanings.sent3: The children pretended to inhume their toys in a make-believe funeral.
meanings.sent4: The memories of the past can sometimes inhume our present happiness.
meanings.sent5: The act of inhuming carries a sense of finality and closure.

meanings.sent1: The soldiers were honored with a ceremony to inhume them in the military cemetery.
meanings.sent2: It is a tradition in our culture to inhume our deceased with respect and dignity.
meanings.sent3: The archaeologists were excited to inhume the ancient artifacts for further study.
meanings.sent4: The secrets of the past are often inhumed in the layers of history.
meanings.sent5: The act of inhuming symbolizes the cycle of life and death.
